GRADUACAO.NOME-AGENCIA: Ente Regionale per il diritto allo Studio Universitario

DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Pseudoeffective cones in 2-Fano varieties and remarks on the Voisin map

POS-DOUTORADO.NOME-AGENCIA: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior

OUTRA-ATIVIDADE-TECNICO-CIENTIFICA.ATIVIDADE-REALIZADA: Tutorias nas disciplinas Análise 1, Análise 2 e Geometria

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Moduli space of contact curves in the projective space.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: It is well known that an odd dimensional complex projective space carries a canonical contact structure. In 2011 Levcovitz and Vainsencher gave first steps towards the enumeration of rational curves of any degree d tangent to the contact distribution in the three dimensional space. Later on, Amorim constructed the moduli space M(d) of contact rational curves in P^3 of degree d as the stack of zeros of a section of a vector bundle on the Kontsevich space of rational stable maps. Thanks to a result of Bryant, we know that the component of M(d) parametrizing smooth curves has the expected dimension 2d+1. Furthermore for d at most 4, the dimension of M(d) is the expected one and therefore the homology class of M(d) is known. This permits us to compute the number of contact curves meeting 2d+1 general lines in P^3 for d<5. A challenging problem would be to find analogous results without any restriction on d, for example by a recursive formula, as well as for other incidence conditions in higher dimension.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: It is well known that an odd dimensional complex projective space carries a canonical contact structure. In 2011 Levcovitz and Vainsencher gave first steps towards the enumeration of rational curves of any degree d tangent to the contact distribution in the three dimensional space. Later on, Amorim constructed the moduli space M(d) of contact rational curves in P^3 of degree d as the stack of zeros of a section of a vector bundle on the Kontsevich space of rational stable maps. Thanks to a result of Bryant, we know that the component of M(d) parametrizing smooth curves has the expected dimension 2d+1. Furthermore for d at most 4, the dimension of M(d) is the expected one and therefore the homology class of M(d) is known. This permits us to compute the number of contact curves meeting 2d+1 general lines in P^3 for d<5. A challenging problem would be to find analogous results without any restriction on d, for example by a recursive formula, as well as for other incidence conditions in higher dimension.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Moduli space of contact curves in the projective space.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: A Recursive Formula for Osculating Curves
Betti numbers and pseudoeffective cones in 2-Fano varieties
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO-INGLES: Betti numbers and pseudoeffective cones in 2-Fano varieties

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The 2-Fano varieties, defined by De Jong and Starr, satisfy some higher dimensional analogous properties of Fano varieties. We propose a definition of (weak) k-Fano variety and conjecture the polyhedrality of the cone of pseudoeffective k-cycles for those varieties in analogy with the case k = 1. Then, we calculate some Betti numbers of a large class of k-Fano varieties to prove some special case of the conjecture. In particular, the conjecture is true for all 2-Fano varieties of index ≥ n − 2, and also we complete the classification of weak 2-Fano varieties answering Questions 39 and 41 in [AC13].

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

FORMACAO-COMPLEMENTAR-DE-EXTENSAO-UNIVER.NOME-CURSO: Corso di perfezionamento e aggiornamento professionale in Percorso formativ

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT This thesis is devoted to the study of the dimensions of the strata of the moduli of smooth pointed curves by fixing Weierstrass semigroups at the marked point. We provide a new lower bound for the dimension of each stratum by diminishing Deligne?Pinkham?s bound by the dimension of the positive graded part of the first module of the cotangent complex associated to a suitable monomial curve. This new lower bound is better than a lower bound given recently by N. Pflueger. We also prove a conditional result which provides the exact dimension when the Weierstrass semigroup is symmetric.
